Methods

LsiRoll(int[], float[], float[], int[], int[], int[], int[], int, int, int, float)

'Roll' Algorithm, Custom Integration based off Tom, et al, courtesy of Owen Yang Owen Yang, David Cuccia, and Bernard Choi, "Real-time blood flow imaging using the graphics processing unit," (paper in preparation)

public static void LsiRoll(int[] raw, float[] speckleContrast, float[] speckleFlowIndex, int[] rollRow, int[] rollColumn, int[] rollRowSquared, int[] rollColumnSquared, int width, int height, int wR, float t)

Parameters

raw int[]

Raw speckle image

speckleContrast float[]

Speckle contrast, pre-allocated 1D matrix

speckleFlowIndex float[]

Speckle flow index, pre-allocated 1D matrix

rollRow int[]

Pre-allocated buffer for holding the strip sum in the row

rollColumn int[]

Pre-allocated buffer for holding the strip sum in the column

rollRowSquared int[]

Pre-allocated buffer for holding the strip sums of squared values in the row

rollColumnSquared int[]

Pre-allocated buffer for holding the strip sums of squared values in the row

width int

Width of the raw speckle image. Also used for calculating the size of the pre-allocated buffers, the 4 buffers are width*1

height int

Height of the raw speckle image

wR int

Size of the sliding window radius

t float

Exposure time of the camera used to obtain the raw speckle images

RollFilter(float[], int, int, int)

'Roll' Algorithm, Custom Integration based off Tom, et al, courtesy of Owen Yang. Owen Yang, David Cuccia, and Bernard Choi, "Real-time blood flow imaging using the graphics processing unit," (paper in preparation)

public static float[] RollFilter(float[] raw, int width, int height, int radius)

Parameters

raw float[]

raw image

width int

image width

height int

image height

radius int

radius of moving window (full window size will be 2*radius+1)

Returns

float[]

processed image

Remarks

Allocates processed image, as well as row and column strip sums and calls the most general overload. Calling this version multiple times with large images will probably thrash the GC.

RollFilter(float[], int, int, int, ref float[])

'Roll' Algorithm, Custom Integration based off Tom, et al, courtesy of Owen Yang. Owen Yang, David Cuccia, and Bernard Choi, "Real-time blood flow imaging using the graphics processing unit," (paper in preparation)

public static void RollFilter(float[] raw, int width, int height, int radius, ref float[] processed)

Parameters

raw float[]

raw image

width int

image width

height int

image height

radius int

radius of moving window (full window size will be 2*radius+1)

processed float[]

pre-allocated processed image destination

Remarks

Allocates row and column strip sums and calls the most general overload

RollFilter(float[], int, int, int, ref float[], ref float[], ref float[])

'Roll' Algorithm, Custom Integration based off Tom, et al, courtesy of Owen Yang. Owen Yang, David Cuccia, and Bernard Choi, "Real-time blood flow imaging using the graphics processing unit," (paper in preparation)

public static void RollFilter(float[] raw, int width, int height, int radius, ref float[] processed, ref float[] rollRow, ref float[] rollColumn)

Parameters

raw float[]

raw image

width int

image width

height int

image height

radius int

radius of moving window (full window size will be 2*radius+1)

processed float[]

pre-allocated processed image destination

rollRow float[]

pre-allocated row strip sum

rollColumn float[]

pre-allocated column strip sum
